hook.text: Some people believe talent is fixed. Others believe skill grows with effort. The second group wins.

buildup.text: Carol Dweck's research showed that a growth mindset â€” believing ability is built â€” leads to persistence.

discovery.text: Programmers with growth mindsets embrace hard bugs as learning opportunities, not threats.

twist.text: Fixed mindset developers avoid challenges to protect their reputation. They plateau early.

climax.text: The belief that you can improve is the single best predictor of whether you actually will.

punchline.text: Believe you can grow and you will.

quiz.question: What does a growth mindset believe about ability?
options: Ability is built through effort and practice
